categories.description: Generated through quantification and qualification of data from sensor networks or cybersecurity services.

sub_categories.name: Global Threat Intelligence
sub_categories.definition: Broad-scale analysis of worldwide adversary tactics, malware families, and evolving threat landscapes based on global telemetry.

sub_categories.name: Regional Assessments
sub_categories.definition: Cybersecurity evaluations and threat forecasts focused on specific geographic nations, territories, or political unions.

sub_categories.name: Sector Specific Intelligence
sub_categories.definition: Targeted analysis of threats and vulnerabilities impacting specific vertical industries such as Finance, Healthcare, Energy, or Transportation.

sub_categories.name: Application Security
sub_categories.definition: Technical assessments of risks involving custom code, APIs, software supply chains, and third-party library dependencies.

sub_categories.name: Cloud Security
sub_categories.definition: Analysis of threats, misconfigurations, and identity risks specifically targeting IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS cloud environments.

sub_categories.name: Vulnerabilities
sub_categories.definition: Data-driven research into CVE disclosure trends, exploitation rates, and organizational remediation performance.

sub_categories.name: Ransomware
sub_categories.definition: In-depth studies of ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operations, extortion tactics, and payment trends.

sub_categories.name: Data Breaches
sub_categories.definition: Quantified analysis of the root causes, patterns, and financial impacts of unauthorized data exfiltration incidents.

sub_categories.name: Physical Security
sub_categories.definition: Security research focusing on physical assets, operational technology (OT), industrial control systems (ICS), and critical infrastructure.

sub_categories.name: AI and Emerging Technologies
sub_categories.definition: Analysis of security risks inherent to or exacerbated by artificial intelligence, Large Language Models (LLMs), and agentic systems.

categories.description: Derived from surveys, interviews, or consulting engagements that capture industry sentiment and practices.

sub_categories.name: Industry Trends
sub_categories.definition: Broad-market sentiment reports detailing shifts in defensive strategies, budget priorities, and general industry outlook.

sub_categories.name: Executive Perspectives
sub_categories.definition: Insights and strategic priorities gathered directly from C-suite leaders such as CISOs, CIOs, and Board members.

sub_categories.name: Workforce and Culture
sub_categories.definition: Studies focusing on the cybersecurity skills gap, talent retention, security awareness culture, and human risk management.

sub_categories.name: Market and Investment Research
sub_categories.definition: Financial analysis of the cybersecurity vendor landscape, including venture capital funding, M&A activity, and sector growth.

sub_categories.name: Application Security
sub_categories.definition: Survey-based research regarding developer habits, AppSec tool adoption, and perceived software supply chain maturity.

sub_categories.name: Cloud Security
sub_categories.definition: Industry sentiment and organizational challenges related to cloud migration, multi-cloud governance, and shared responsibility.

sub_categories.name: Identity Security
sub_categories.definition: Research into the governance of human and non-human identities, including MFA adoption and Zero Trust implementation.

sub_categories.name: Penetration Testing
sub_categories.definition: Findings and trends derived from offensive security engagements, bug bounty programs, and vulnerability disclosure initiatives.

sub_categories.name: Privacy and Data Protection
sub_categories.definition: Analysis of GRC trends, data privacy regulation compliance, and organizational efforts to secure sensitive personal data.

sub_categories.name: Ransomware
sub_categories.definition: Sentiment research regarding organizational ransomware preparedness, recovery confidence, and ransom payment policies.

sub_categories.name: AI and Emerging Technologies
sub_categories.definition: Industry outlook on AI adoption risks, ethical governance, and the readiness of security teams to manage AI-native threats.
